newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine cash soybeans track Chicago higher.
newsitem.headline: Argentine cash soybeans track Chicago higher.

text.p: Argentine soybeans followed Chicago bean prices higher in tight cash market trade at the Buenos Aires Cereals Exchange, dragging other grains up with them, traders said.

Prices paid to farmers for May soybeans rose $9 to $307. April sunflower seed followed soy up $7 to $225. Spot maize and wheat were also higher. Buenos Aires maize climbed $2 to $110, while Bahia Blanca wheat rose $4 to $151. Wheat prices were bouyed by solid demand from local millers. The rises in grain prices were accentuated by speculation, but scepticism as to how long the rally will last helped keep volume low.
